@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez Oh, yes you are right... You need 2 extra polynomials to go from 3n to 2n and from there, in starks you can just prove that A*B /Z is deg <n. While I‚Äôm writing I think you can do it with just one extra polynomial. Thinking...

RT @epicenterbtc: üöÄNEW EPISODEüöÄ
This week @tw_tter chatted to @jbaylina from @PolygonHermez  about how the protocol works, the recent merge‚Ä¶
@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez For pure plookup, in stark it works very well, because you just need 2n polynomials. You don‚Äôt need any axtra commitment.

@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez I don‚Äôt think it‚Äôs worthy to do it in plonk nether, you would need to commit to 5 extra polynomials. I don‚Äôt think it compensates the earning in fft.

@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez Yes, exactly! C is the extra polynomial you have to commit..
The cool thing is that if you want to prove A*B + C*D + E*F ..... = 0 you need only one extra polynomial...

@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez Imagine you want to prove A*B = C in H.  
A*B= Q*Z + C. You can commit also to Q. So you can do polynomial multiplicarions without increasing the degree...
@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez Yes! Exactly! We don‚Äôt care about the stark proof size becouse it will be a private input of the groth16 circuit!
@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez We are not sure yet. But the idea is to compensate with more queries..

@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez We will try to work with 2x domain extension (adding extra polynomials if required). And the last levels of the merkle tree we can use sha256 to improve proving time (at the cost of extra constraints in the stark verifier).

@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez We are studying GPU‚Äôs. Besides that, the idea is to send each polynomial to different machines.  We have been thinking also to build a supercomuper with butterfly network connection schema. But we will try the other approaches first.

@Zac_Aztec @cryptoMaxi420 @SoSoCrypto2 @PolygonHermez fft‚Äôs and poseidon hash is computing intensive work. We are working to optimize it as much as we can because this will limit the gas we will be able to process. The cool thing is that in starks we don‚Äôt need to do exponentiations. And we can always parallelize those computations.
